Comment: I recommend everyone go watch some of the recent YouTube videos (or listen in podcast form) from Nick Freitas. There‚Äôs some really good explanation of what might be going on here. The extremely short version is that it seems likely that this is about bringing manufacturing back to the US, not about reciprocity of tariffs, and the whole situation is attempting to stop or at least mitigate a massive depression stemming from 50 years of negative trade balances. It‚Äôs both compelling and terrifying as discussions go but the worst part is that is that makes a ton of sense and is backed up by data and existing economic theory and principles.

Author: Germy_1114

Comment: Trump has gut instincts about a lot of stuff, and that's generally how he governs. That's my theory.   So he has a gut instinct that illegal immigration is a problem. Entering the country illegally has to be stopped, and committing further crimes while already inside illegally is even worse.   And that's a pretty popular gut instinct.   He also has the gut instinct that trade deficits are bad.   This might be a *common* gut instinct... But it's just plain old wrong. There's no other way to say it.   I mean, how on God's green earth is the trade balance between the US and Vietnam ever going to be equal?  Vietnamese people earn like about 3000 bucks a year. They have no money to buy F150s and computer software!  Which is what the US sells!  When someone purchases something, they do it because they already think they're getting a good deal. I want a t shirt, and I see one on sale for 10 bucks, good deal, I buy it.   I don't then also want to sell 10 bucks worth of stuff back to Walmart to somehow make things fair...  Well I'm sorry, but "trade deficit" talk is *exactly* as stupid sounding as trying to sell stuff back to Walmart so you don't have a trade deficit with them.
